com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp

Class MvpFragment<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.MvpFragment<V,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MvpLceFragment, MvpViewStateFragment

    public abstract class MvpFragment<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends Fragment
implements MvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpView
    A Fragment that uses a MvpPresenter to implement a Model-View-Presenter architecture
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • createPresenter

        public abstract P createPresenter()
        Creates a new presenter instance, if needed. Will reuse the previous presenter instance if #setRetainInstance(boolean) is set to true. This method will be called from onViewCreated(View, Bundle)
        Specified by:
        createPresenter in interface MvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        the created presenter instance

      • getMvpDelegate

        protected FragmentMvpDelegate<V,P> getMvpDelegate()
        * Get the mvp delegate. This is internally used for creating presenter, attaching and detaching view from presenter.

        Please note that only one instance of mvp delegate should be used per fragment instance.

        Only override this method if you really know what you are doing.

        Returns:
        FragmentMvpDelegateImpl

      • getPresenter

        public P getPresenter()
        Description copied from interface: MvpDelegateCallback
        Get the presenter. If null is returned, then a internally a new presenter instance gets created by calling MvpDelegateCallback.createPresenter()
        Specified by:
        getPresenter in interface MvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        the presenter instance. can be null.
